title: Fix Bug in Dragable example
body:
**Tested in Tested in latest Chrome 26.0.1410.65 for OS X**
In the example with draggable, the mouseDown handler needs to start with an `event.preventDefault()`.  Otherwise the following bug occurs:

1) Select the text of the draggable span by clicking outside the span and dragging the mouse to the left or right through the span. Release the mouse button.
2) Now click on the span's inner text, and start to Drag it.  The browser's default functionality that drags highlighted text so that it can be pasted into something else (say a document in a text editor) is invoked.
3) Release the mouse button. Now suddenly, you'll be dragging the span. But you won't be able to place it down on the page.  It'll just follow the mouse around until the page is refreshed.

The added line fixes this.

title: Change opening to be more specific and clear.
feat($locale): add a `set` method to change the locale
refactor(core): use native String.prototype.trim if available
feat(Future): add ready function to Future object
feat (ng-pluralize): add alternative mapping using attributes
body:
When using ngPluralize, I found myself having to escape the characters " and '.
This PR adds an alternative way to define the mapping using attributes to the <ng-pluralize> element like this

```html
<ng:pluralize count='viewCount' offset='1'
    _0='Nobody is viewing.'
    _1='{{p1}} is viewing.'
    one='{{p1}} and one other person are viewing.'
    other='{{p1}} and {} other people are viewing.'>
</ng:pluralize>
```

title: Adding an example unit test for directives
body: Adding an example unit test for directives

title: feat($q): Add optional canceler and promise.cancel method
body:
Add an optional argument to $q.defer to provide a canceling function.
This exposes a promise.cancel method that can be used to call the
canceling function and reject the promise.

See existing implementations in [Dojo Toolkit](http://dojotoolkit.org/api/dojo/Deferred) and [Promised-IO](http://github.com/kriszyp/promised-io) library
for reference.

This will make it easier to implement things like #1159.

title: Fixing a typo with IE warning
body: It just doesn't make sense with a "w".

title: feat(docs): Docs Localization
(doc) Fix select documentation
body: Select documentation was still referring to binding to name, when it should be ng-model instead. Fixed it.

title: test(modules): fix module tests which got disabled by ngMobile
body:
When ngMobile was merged in, we accidentaly included angular-scenario.js
in the test file set for modules. Loading this file overrode jasmine's
`it` and `describe` global functions which essentially disabled all of
~200 unit tests for wrapped modules.

This change refactors the code to run the wrapped module tests.

I had to extract browserTrigger from scenario runner in order to achieve
this without code duplication.

title: [doc] fix typo in input doc
Typo fix
fix($resource): return result from prototype methods
body:
1. ```Resource[name]``` returns ```value``` that contains ```$then``` and other useful things. [#L476](https://github.com/angular/angular.js/blob/master/src/ngResource/resource.js#L476)
2. ```Resource.prototype['$' + name]``` invokes ```Resource[name]``` at the end but returns nothing. [#L502](https://github.com/angular/angular.js/blob/master/src/ngResource/resource.js#L502)

__Possible fix:__  add ```return``` state to the end of the ```Resource.prototype['$' + name]``` definition.

title: fix(ngLocation): check for javascript: in URL
body: Fixes #2434

title: Replace:false in directive doesn't "append" as documented
body:
According to the [documentation](http://docs.angularjs.org/guide/directive):

> `replace` - if set to `true` then the template will replace the current element, rather than append the template to the element.

As identified by #2235, the documented behaviour does not match the actual current behaviour.

title: docs(guide:e2e) :improve e2e testing guide
body:
Create working examples for testing select fields, input fields etc
in e2e testing.
- line Item count example
- line item val example
- line item change example

Will add more shortly.

title: The sample input only turns red when blank
body: Update the bullet point to reflect this fact.  Tested in FF 20 and Chrome 26.

title: Spelling correction.
docs(directive): add <a name="Definition">
body: This makes the "Directive Definition Object" heading bookmarkable.  It's such a handy reference and deserves an id.

title: fix(ngModel): handle interpolated names for ngModel
body:
Fix that controls with interpolated names don't publish
themselves to the form, cause the name isn't known at
publishing time.

Refers #1404

title: Adding `always` method to `$q` service.
fix(angular): do not copy $$hashKey in copy/extend functions.
body:
Copying the $$hashKey as part of copy/extend operations makes little
sense since hashkey is used primarily as an object id, especially in
the context of the ngRepeat directive. This change maintains the
existing $$hashKey of an object that is being copied into (likewise for
extend).
It is not uncommon to take an item in a collection, copy it,
and then append it to the collection. By copying the $$hashKey, this
leads to duplicate object errors with the current ngRepeat.

Closes #1875

title: docs(ngClassEven): make consistent with ngClassOdd
Fix typo in compile/link separation paragraph
body: The code snippet shows `{{action.description}}`, the explanation referred to it as `{{action.descriptions}}`.

title: Fix typo in Injector call inlining example
body: the actual invoke call in the documentation was referring to the non-existent `tempFn` instead of `tmpFn`

title: Escape all characters above \u007f at the i18n directory
body:
Modify the script that writes the locales so all characters above \u007f are escaped
Run the modified script and update the locales

Closes #2417
